   67M w/St. [**Male First Name (un) 6198**] mechanical aortic valve admitted [**Date range (3) 12204**] for
   subtherapeutic INR now on lovenox bridge and coumadin who presents with
   2 days of low back pain and found to have retroperitoneal hematoma in
   setting of 8 point hct drop.
   .
   # RETROPERITONEAL BLEED. Retroperitoneal bleed found on CT torso
   w/contrast; 8 point Hct drop; systolics in 70s; on [**5-15**] received 2
   units FFP and 2 units pRBCs, 3.2L IVF in ED, more IVF on floor. On
   floor systolics in 100s (baseline 140s even on antihypertensives); HR
   in 80s. Hct 39.2 on [**5-9**] -> 31.4 at 12pm -> 25.5 at 3pm -> 26.6 at 6pm
   (during second unit pRBC). Etiology for bleed unclear; appears
   spontaneous in setting of supratherapeutic INR and lovenox bridge. CT
   negative for dissection; no history of trauma or recent intravascular
   manipulation/procedures.
   - Maintain active type and screen, 2 large bore PIV, 2 units crossed in
   blood bank
   - Hct q4h, transfuse for Hct > 25
   - Vascular surgery following: appreciate recs - for now will defer to
   IR
   - IR following; will not intervene without INR < 2. Overnight pt still
   bleeding despite INR < 2, pt to angio but no active extravasation seen.
   IR will follow.
   - Hold home ASA/coumadin/lovenox, hold antihypertensives
   - Monitor UOP and I/Os and pressures; IVF or blood products for MAP <
   65 or UOP < 30 cc/hr
   - Monitor bladder pressure to assess for compartment syndrome in
   setting of distention (initially 21), elevated lactate, decreased UOP.
   - Trend lactate
   - General surgery following for increased abdominal pressure:
   appreciate recs - ?angio for embolization (unsigned note)
   - Morphine for abdominal pain but watch blood pressures
   - Transfuse Plts if < 50
   - Guaiac stools
   .

   pt on coumadin with lovenox bridge. INR slightly supratherapeutic at
   4.2 on admission (goal 2.5-3.5). [**5-16**] INR decreased to 2.0 s/p 4 units
   FFP.
   - Ordered for 2 more units FFP (for total of 6 by [**5-16**] by 7am)

   - Cardiology recommended initially holding vitamin K but given
   continued bleeding, gave 5 mg [**5-16**] AM

   and Hct stable X 24 hours without transfusions
   - Continue home dicloxacillin for endocarditis prophylaxis
   .
